Package com.android

Class Human

java.lang.Object
com.android.Human
public class Human
extends Object
Human class will be used to show the Invariant Design Principle To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial
Author:
NoelF
See Also:
Examples.ex1()

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int age
    the age of a Human and every Human has a age greater than 0
    private String name
    the name of a Human and we are going to ensure every human has a non null name

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Human​(String name, int age)
    Constructor that taks a String and a int constructors call the setName() method with the string name sent to the constructor, which ensures that the name is not null and is not just a blank string Constructor calls the setAge() method with the int age sent to the constructor, which ensures the age is greater than 0 or we could assign a default name or a default age, and require that this name and age be replaced at a later stage in the code

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getAge()
    getter for the age variable
    String getName()
    getter for the name variable
    private void setAge​(int age)
    setter for age that ensures age will be greater than 0
    private void setName​(String name)
    Setter for name that ensures that name is not null we can add more complex rules in the setters without effecting other users of the class as long as we don't change the method signature of the setters it will not effect other users of the code

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • name

      private String name
      the name of a Human and we are going to ensure every human has a non null name

    • age

      private int age
      the age of a Human and every Human has a age greater than 0

  • Constructor Details

    • Human

      Human​(String name, int age)
      Constructor that taks a String and a int constructors call the setName() method with the string name sent to the constructor, which ensures that the name is not null and is not just a blank string Constructor calls the setAge() method with the int age sent to the constructor, which ensures the age is greater than 0 or we could assign a default name or a default age, and require that this name and age be replaced at a later stage in the code
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the Human
      age - is the age of the Human

  • Method Details

    • setName

      private void setName​(String name)
      Setter for name that ensures that name is not null we can add more complex rules in the setters without effecting other users of the class as long as we don't change the method signature of the setters it will not effect other users of the code
      Parameters:
      name - will be used to set the name of a Human

    • setAge

      private void setAge​(int age)
      setter for age that ensures age will be greater than 0
      Parameters:
      age - will be used to set the age of a Human

    • getName

      public String getName()
      getter for the name variable
      Returns:
      the name of the Human

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      getter for the age variable
      Returns:
      the age of the Human
